website_summaries.verdict: The Westone ADV Alpha delivers powerful audio in an outdoor-friendly design, but its sturdy build isn't cheap.
pros: Powerful audio performance with no distortion and deep bass response
cons: Could use a bit more high-mid presence
Priced a little high compared to fitness earphone competition

customer_reviews.title: Good until premature failure. Good customer support from Westone though.
customer_reviews.text: I received the headphones in February and was happy for the most part. They did not sound as good as the Klipsch set I had for around 8 years but they were close enough and less expensive. Barely 3 months later the left earbud starts cutting off intermittently. I had to constantly play with the cable to get it to come on. I initially thought it was the headphone jack in my ipod but the problem was there on my other devices as well. If they work they are 4 star headphones. Edit: Contacted Westone support and they replaced the headset with the Alpha's. So far no complaints since they are essentially the same headphones as far as sound goes.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cama

customer_reviews.title: Good, but would rather have a better storage case.
customer_reviews.text: I used to work for Westone so please take this with a grain of salt, but know I try my best to be unbiased. I love these headphones. The sound quality, and durability are exactly what I need in my current job. The only major drawback is the storage case isn’t pocket friendly, and isn’t as nice as some other pocket cases out there.
customer_reviews.author: Cyborgladiator

customer_reviews.title: I like all the swivel options so that you can adjust ...
customer_reviews.text: I like all the swivel options so that you can adjust the angle, and the iPhone controls are good. However, I find that these have really bright highs. I've also used Westone UM in-ears and loved (and lost) them, but these are kinda piercing in the high end, and I find myself adjusting the EQ on things if I can.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Herman

customer_reviews.title: Don't Perform as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds are used almost exclusively for running on an indoor treadmill. The earbuds worked wonderfully for about 3 days. Then, the sound went out completely. I left them sitting for a few days planning to request a return. I put them on and tested them, and they were working again. Presumably they dried out?? After another 10 days or so of use, thought, the sound in both sides has diminished and not returned. These aren't the most expensive, but they're not cheap drugstore buds either. I've requested a return from the Amazon Seller. Failing that, I'll request an exchange or return via Westone Audio.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Great for the shop
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for hearing protection in the cabinet shop where I work. They, with appropriate tips for your needs, block out sound well and provide connection to your audio device. They have been durable. They work well for my purposes. I give them 5 stars for my purpose, but would give them 4 stars if I bought them for my primary earbuds. They are a little boomy for just listening, there are better options out there, but I couldn't pass them up for the price offered here. I bought 2 pairs to have a spare.
customer_reviews.author: JEKirby

customer_reviews.title: These are good headphones, but the cable is /extremely/ irritating if ...
customer_reviews.text: These are good headphones, but the cable is /extremely/ irritating if you wear it in contact with your skin (underneath a shirt). The quality of the cable is also questionable. The heat shrink tubing just slides off. The earpieces are also poor quality. After using the foam inserts a few times, the foam completely detaches. These also just split in half.... They are not unibody. Where the colour changes is where the separate pieces come together. They are held together internally by a plastic clip....
customer_reviews.author: Jarret

customer_reviews.title: good sounds. s*** fit
customer_reviews.text: I have the Alpha series which I was a fan of but eventually it gave notice and I'm in the process of getting it sent for service. I bought these to hold me over while the other set was getting the wheels kicked and shined up. Simply put they don't stay hinged on with the little doo-hickeys they give to clip over the ear. Further more even without the over the ear adapter they wont stay put if you're an especially sweaty dude. sounded as expected from Westone which was a 10/10 but overall fit was 2/10.
customer_reviews.author: BlkhorseRugby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent earphones!!
customer_reviews.text: I use headphones during workouts and have ruined 2 other pairs of headphones by sweating on the controls. These have been very durable and are impervious to my sweat. I also think they sound great. Some people say they sound too "bassy" but, i found it easy to just change my EQ setting to my preferences. I will DEFINITELY recommend and buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Good all-around IEM for seekers of the provided sound signature; lots of tight bass, good clarity, med soundstage, recessed mids
customer_reviews.text: Good detail with lots of well-extended (but thick bass), and somewhat recessed vocals in the mids. Good Soundstage and instrument separation. Great build quality and accesories' inclusion. The "beta" iteration has less bass (yet still a lot), that sounds somewhat muddier/woolier than the alpha. Still a great headphone, however, if you like your bass. The fit on both the alpha and the beta is great; comfortable and feels non-existent, especially with the correctly ear-matched tips. Bass feels slightly more controlled while listening using the true-fit foam tips. Recommended for bassheads who want high-quality bassy sound. Not recommended for activities due to price; best to use something cheaper and easily replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: nantippas

customer_reviews.title: Microphone went out within the first week
customer_reviews.text: Received these just over a month ago and the microphone is already defective. It worked for at least the first week but soon went out. Hate it because I like to be able to switch over to my phone if necessary. Speakers are still working on the earpieces but, for this price, eexpected better quality.
customer_reviews.author: momtomkev

customer_reviews.title: The sound clarity is wonderful and it adapts to your ear perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The sound clarity is wonderful and it adapts to your ear perfectly. The cord is long enough that allows me to work out at the gym with no problems at all
customer_reviews.author: Francisco A Arias Reyes

customer_reviews.title: worked better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: the sound was amazing and it blocks out the external noise well which has made it perfect for exercise. It took me some experimentation to find the right ear bud fit however with he myriad of options there was one set that was the perfect fit. I have had more expensive head phones both in the ear and over the ear that have not worked as well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding ear buds but flawed Ear Cable hook (Up and Over Adapter)
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, delivery was quick, packaging was very good, reasonable price and I would buy this again. I have two nominal concerns (not enough to affect rating) ... 1) the plastic tree that holds the ear buds made it tricky to get the ear buds out and 2) the plastic/rubber over-the-ear pieces do not hold the ear bud in place very well (small for the ear bud cables) so I use these without the over-the-ear pieces. I use these as in-ear-monitors (IEMs). I have an Android phone but I did not plan to use these with my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: If i hadn't gotten these on sale I would be ...
customer_reviews.text: If i hadn't gotten these on sale I would be a little miffed. Even the smallest size earbuds they come with are a little too big and I have to constantly keep pushing them back in so they don't fall out. If the cord rubs against anything (each other, a jacket collar or sleeve) while they're in it is incredibly loud.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: It stoped working in the 5th time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I bought one "Westone 78400 Adventure Series Alpha" in November 2014 I used it for... probably 5 times, but today ( February 25, 2015) the volume control just stopped working at all. I am really disappointed with this product, because I though it would be really durable, but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: pedro lamounier

customer_reviews.title: Extreme "U" shaped sound signature.
customer_reviews.text: Extreme "U" shaped sound signature. Also beware that it takes quite a bit of power to drive these properly. There are 2 things you will hear with this earbud....at the high end is a thin and spitty treble, at the low end is a heavy and massive wave of bass. Transients are slow as mud though. The midrange is so hollowed out as to appear to be 20 feet behind the drumkit. They are the opposite of the Shure "house sound" (which have sublime midrange) They are very well made earbuds. They look like they can survive anything. Cables are a raspy cloth and quite a bit of microphonics.
customer_reviews.author: LT. John

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the sound of these headphones. I use them as in-ear-monitors when playing drums. The Good: Sound is amazing. Bass heavy. Chord is very durable and stylish (reflective) Has a remote for iPhone The Bad: The "y-joint" can't be adjusted so they can't be fitted snug to the back of your head. It's a pain to get the headphones inside the provided case Overall: Love these and they work really well for monitoring purposes. I would buy these again but maybe in a different model to address my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Wikoli

customer_reviews.title: Great buds!!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, superior fit, super light you don't realize there even in your ear.... Also bass head aproved, ( not muddy, yet sharp pronounced bass)
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: $150 buds for $39 - a steal
customer_reviews.text: For $150, not that good. For $39, great set of all-purpose earbuds that can take a beating. I have a pair of Westone W20, but wasn't crazy about moving lawn with them. Needed a pair of "beaters". These are beaters...tha deliver on sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Duvall

customer_reviews.title: I like these headphones but at times they hurt my ears
customer_reviews.text: I like these headphones but at times they hurt my ears. Also the bass doesn't sound to great. Expected better for the price
customer_reviews.author: A. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and plenty of in ear options for comfort and fit
customer_reviews.author: RichmondTN

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in the amount of time loss with it as ...
customer_reviews.text: Cord broke week 2. I also bought the UM30 Pro model and the cord and quick detach is much sturdier. I was disappointed in the amount of time loss with it as well having swapped it onto my triple driver 30's to use them as an around town ear monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd beard

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed but sound reproduction is poor.
customer_reviews.text: This product is well designed with great components, cables, and ear tips. However, its sound reproduction is rather poor, It is very difficult to make out mid frequencies, and high frequencies tended to sound a bit shrill and harsh. Lows sounded boomy and not not tight. I will not recommend this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Justice

customer_reviews.title: good base and not so articulated but clear highs I ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit hard to drive but, good base and not so articulated but clear highs I price range. Comes with full variety of tips and gorgeous case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Monitors died after less than three months, after about 5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: The Austinson Family

customer_reviews.title: good sound, best of all they don't fall out ...
customer_reviews.text: Compact, good sound, best of all they don't fall out when I run.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I received these super fast and I love them
customer_reviews.text: I received these super fast and I love them. They are high quality and fit my ears perfectly. I never feel as if they will fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Momma J

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality build
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about them except the carrying case. It is pictured in the product description but I failed to grasp how unwieldy the size make it. It is rigid plastic and closes with a half turn as the top is threaded to the bottom. They are well built, very comfortable and sound great. I choose the Sure E215 instead because they seemed more robust, seemed to have better base sound and had a more convenient case. Also, the Sure's came with a second cord with the control buttons.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cochez-lind

customer_reviews.title: Nice headsets
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these. Always in search of perfect headset. So far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Best earphone for running
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many types of earphone for running and these are way better than anything I've tried. Brilliant sound, very well made and firmly stay in position when running long distances. Top product, the best. Five Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Edwards

customer_reviews.title: ... fit is exceptional but it does not isolate noise like other Westone
customer_reviews.text: Sound and fit is exceptional but it does not isolate noise like other Westone.
customer_reviews.author: Shalendra Singh

customer_reviews.title: They are OK. Not sure they are worth the ...
customer_reviews.text: They are OK. Not sure they are worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: paka

customer_reviews.title: Sonic brilliance at a low price
customer_reviews.text: excellent quality sound , rich highs tight bass. At thi price a sonic steal.
customer_reviews.author: MSB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to run with
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound! Easy to run with, and cable has reflecting material on outside...
customer_reviews.author: Moses Cashmere

customer_reviews.title: caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, while it lasts. About 2 months in left ear bud gave out due to shoddy cable. Unfortunately click.click99 is not one of a handful of "authorized" Westone distributors so the Warranty does not apply. Glad I got the insurance, but for the price and something advertised as "adventure" I expect a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Trowa Barton

customer_reviews.title: great sound! not real sturdy though
customer_reviews.text: great sound! not real sturdy though, hence only 3 stars. They got knocked off and one speaker broke open. I was able to glue it back together and it still sounds good, but even cheap headphones usually don't break from falling off of ones head! Still, I would consider these a decent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: doctor435

customer_reviews.title: Volume is decent but quality is not as good as other Westone headphones
customer_reviews.text: Volume is decent but quality is not as good as other Westone headphones. The pieces that connect for using over the ear seemed to fall off and vanish.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Stein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best corded pair I have ever used for running. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones. Fit perfect and sound reproduction is very good. Much better build quality than my bose.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Hurlbert, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: sound quality all ok, but my Mic stopped working after 6 months...and this is supposed to be an adventure durable headset?
customer_reviews.author: Guido Post

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good. Ear loops don't stay in place for some ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good. Ear loops don't stay in place for some reason. Have tried all the insert sizes, with and without clip. Weird EXCELLENT CONSTRUCTION>High Quality product. Just doesn't work well with my anatomy. Need to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid like a tank earbuds, and the bass is not as overwhelming but similar to the V-Moda Bass Freq.
customer_reviews.author: bikoy

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad bass, messy treble. Don't buy if you expect high quality sound. Ergonomic, cable and fit is great, though.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: These sound almost as good as the $700 ES2
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a set of custom molded Westone ES2 in-ear monitors for about 13 years, so I am familiar with the Westone sound and quality. I have recently started to travel quite a bit, and was in the market for a quality set of monitors in the $100 - $150 range. These sound almost as good as the $700 ES2! I am not happy with the cloth coated cable. The ES2 has a braided metal exterior, which is non absorbent, and much more flexible. Where I would never use these on-stage, they are a nice upgrade for those who demand more from a set of personal monitors, without getting into the custom fit models.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Speegle

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Well I purchased these head phones with high hopes. Unfortunately the first time I used them on my apple computer, the phones for some odd reason kept shocking my ear canals. Im not sure why this is happening. Getting shocked in the ear canal is not pleasant. For the money I spent I'm very dissapointed..
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M Varela

product_meta.title: Westone Alpha Adventure 6.5mm Mirco Driver In-Ear Earphones - IPX Weather Resistant with 3 AWACS Reflective Cable and Microphone
product_meta.description:
Style:Alpha| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingDesigned for the active music enthusiast, the Westone Alpha is an IPX Weather resistant earphone and features a 6.5mm micro driver that delivers audiophile level sound while you're being active. 

The Alpha takes advantage of all the innovations and expertise that Westone has developed in almost 60 years of designing and manufacturing products for the human ear. Whether you are exercising, commuting, traveling, or just relaxing and listening to your favorite music, our True-Fit Earphones are so comfortable that they can be worn for hours and hours – you may even forget that you are wearing them. Westone’s proprietary silicone and comfort-foam eartips are provided in 5 different sizes, and enhance the performance of our True-Fit Earphones, by ensuring superior noise isolation and a superb fit, surrounding sounds are reduced an average of 25 dB, which allows you to listen without any interruptions or distractions. 

The Westone Alpha was designed by musicians and music lovers, their goal is to help you get the most out of the music you love, live, and enjoy, no matter what you listen to
feature_bullets: 6.5mm MICRO DRIVER TECHNOLOGY: Westone's proprietary extended range 6.5 mm micro driver with precision surface tuning delivers sonic accuracy with extended bass, ensuring high fidelity in your listening. This technology allows you to enjoy a Westone quality IEM while being active.

THE MOST COMPACT, LOW PROFILE, ERGONOMIC DESIGN IN THE WORLD: The Alpha takes advantage of all the innovations and expertise that Westone has developed in almost 60 years of designing and manufacturing products for the human ear. The Alpha is so comfortable that they can be worn for hours and hours - you may even forget that you are wearing them. Westone’s silicone and comfort-foam eartips enhance the performance in-ear earphones by ensuring superior noise isolation, and a superb fit

IPX WEATHER RESISTENCE: Designed with IPX weather resistance, the Alpha provides against spraying water, sweat, and any adverse conditions you come across in your adventures. Worry less about how wet conditions are impacting your earphones and start enjoying your music more.

AWACS REFLECTIVE CABLE WITH MICROPHONE: Westone's Adventure Warning and Control System gives you better visibility in low-light and adverse conditions with a reflective, replaceable cable featuring a 3-button control system and mircophone for a perfect combination while you're on the go.

IN THE BOX: Purchase Includes: 1 Pair Westone Alpha In Ear Earphones, Crush Resistant Travel Case, Five Sizes Of Patented STAR Silicone And Five Sizes Of TRUE-Fit Foam Assorted Ear Tips, Inline Volume Attenuator And Wax Loop For Cleaning.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars122 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
